channel.title: Creating a .txt file with a batch
channel.description:
edit: solved, thanks a lot cruel ! :)
im trying to use make a batch file which compiles a java file, archives the classes into an executable jar, then deletes the classes
i can do all of that, except for part of the jar, you need to make a text file from which the compiler reads the main class from
iv searched google, but all i get is tutorials on how to make batch files,
can someone tell me how to create a .txt file and write characters to it
note: the line in the file has to end with a carrage return, can you tell me how to write that in?
while i was searching google, this is the cloest i got
[u]small file writing tut[/u] 1. open command prompt and cd your way to a directory 2. enter "copy con nameoffile.txt 3. type whatever you want to go into the file 4. when you want to end, press control + z 5. the symbol ^Z with come up, enter it
iv tried and this cant be used in batch files

item.title: Creating a .txt file with a batch
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

echo This is a virus! > DO_NOT_OPEN.txt echo Just kidding >> DO_NOT_OPEN.txt
Second line appends.

Read full topic
item.source: Creating a .txt file with a batch

item.title: Creating a .txt file with a batch
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

edit: solved, thanks a lot cruel !

im trying to use make a batch file which
compiles a java file,
archives the classes into an executable jar,
then deletes the classes

i can do all of that, except for part of the jar,
you need to make a text file from which the compiler reads the main class from

iv searched google, but all i get is tutorials on how to make batch files,

can someone tell me how to create a .txt file and write characters to it

note: the line in the file has to end with a carrage return, can you tell me how to write that in?

while i was searching google, this is the cloest i got

small file writing tut

  1. open command prompt and cd your way to a directory
  2. enter "copy con nameoffile.txt
  3. type whatever you want to go into the file
  4. when you want to end, press control + z
  5. the symbol ^Z with come up, enter it

iv tried and this cant be used in batch files

Read full topic
item.source: Creating a .txt file with a batch
